intro: Strychnos xinguensis, commonly known as the Xingu tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, orange aril. It is often found in humid, lowland areas and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
